title: Learn Prompting (Long Form)
summary: Comprehensive prompt engineering guide covering beginner to advanced concepts including prompt types, formatting, and evaluation.

topics.description: Ask the model to perform a task without any examples. Best for simple tasks.
Give 1-3 examples to show format or logic. Helps with more complex tasks.
topics.example: Translate 'Hello: Hola', 'Goodbye: Adiós', 'Please: Por favor', 'Thank you: Gracias'

topics.description: Encourages the model to reason step-by-step before giving an answer.
topics.example: If there are 3 cars and each has 4 wheels, how many wheels total? Let's think step by step...

sections.name: Prompt Construction Tips
tips: State the desired format of the answer.
Set expectations for length or style.

sections.name: Prompt Evaluation
methods: Compare outputs to gold standard answers.
Test multiple prompt variants for accuracy.

sections.name: Common Mistakes
mistakes: Mixing multiple tasks in one prompt.
Asking for things the model can't do.

sections.name: Style & Tone
notes: You can control the model’s style by prompting tone explicitly (e.g., friendly, formal, humorous).
This is useful for brand voice consistency.

sections.name: Data Formatting
examples: Use JSON, CSV, or tables to structure output.
Delimit text using triple quotes or tags.
